Package akka.http.javadsl.server.directives

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    ContentTypeResolver
    Implement this interface to provide a custom mapping from a file name to a [[akka.http.javadsl.model.ContentType]].
    DirectoryRenderer  
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AttributeDirectives
    Extracts the value of the request attribute with the given key.
    BasicDirectives
    Runs the inner route with settings mapped by the given function.
    CacheConditionDirectives
    Wraps its inner route with support for Conditional Requests as defined by http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232 In particular the algorithm defined by http://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc7232#section-6 is implemented by this directive.
    CachingDirectives
    Wraps its inner Route with caching support using the given Cache implementation and keyer function.
    CachingDirectives$
    Wraps its inner Route with caching support using the given Cache implementation and keyer function.
    CodingDirectives
    Rejects the request with an UnacceptedResponseEncodingRejection if the given response encoding is not accepted by the client.
    CookieDirectives
    Extracts the HttpCookiePair with the given name.
    DebuggingDirectives
    Produces a log entry for every incoming request.
    DirectoryListing  
    ExecutionDirectives
    Transforms exceptions thrown during evaluation of its inner route using the given ExceptionHandler.
    FileAndResourceDirectives
    Completes GET requests with the content of the given resource loaded from the default ClassLoader, using the default content type resolver.
    FileInfo
    Name of the form field the file was uploaded in
    FileUploadDirectives
    Streams the bytes of the file submitted using multipart with the given file name into a designated file on disk.
    FormFieldDirectives
    Extracts HTTP form fields from the request as a Map.
    FramedEntityStreamingDirectives
    EXPERIMENTAL API
    FramedEntityStreamingDirectives$  
    FutureDirectives
    "Unwraps" a CompletionStage and runs the inner route after future completion with the future's value as an extraction of type Try.
    HeaderDirectives
    Checks that request comes from the same origin.
    HostDirectives
    Extracts the hostname part of the Host request header value.
    LogEntry
    Optionally produces a log entry for every request/response combination.
    LogEntry$  
    MarshallingDirectives
    Unmarshalls the request using the given unmarshaller, and passes the result to [inner].
    MethodDirectives
    Changes the HTTP method of the request to the value of the specified query string parameter.
    MiscDirectives
    Checks the given condition before running its inner route.
    ParameterDirectives  
    PathDirectives
    Rejects the request if the unmatchedPath of the RequestContext is non-empty, or said differently: only passes on the request to its inner route if the request path has been matched completely.
    RangeDirectives
    Answers GET requests with an Accept-Ranges: bytes header and converts HttpResponses coming back from its inner route into partial responses if the initial request contained a valid Range request header.
    RespondWithDirectives
    Unconditionally adds the given response header to all HTTP responses of its inner Route.
    RouteAdapter
    INTERNAL API
    RouteAdapter$
    Java DSL: Adapt an existing ScalaDSL Route as an Java DSL Route
    RouteDirectives Deprecated
    Use the RouteDirectives.concat method instead.
    SchemeDirectives
    Extracts the Uri scheme from the request.
    SecurityDirectives
    Extracts the potentially present HttpCredentials provided with the request's Authorization header.
    SecurityDirectives.ProvidedCredentials  
    SecurityDirectives.ProvidedCredentials$  
    SecurityDirectives$
    Represents HTTP Basic or OAuth2 authentication credentials supplied with a request.
    TimeoutDirectives
    Tries to set a new request timeout and handler (if provided) at the same time.
    WebSocketDirectives Deprecated
    use webSocketUpgrade instead since 10.2.0
  • Annotation Types Summary 
    Annotation Type Description
    CorrespondsTo
    INTERNAL API â€“ used for consistency specs Used to hint at consistency spec implementations that a given JavaDSL method corresponds to a method of given name in ScalaDSL.
